subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Wednesday, 23 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Live - AC Milan v Liverpool
AC Milan and Liverpool are set to go head-to-head in the Champions League final in Athens.



 
Molby wants Crouch & Kuyt pairing
Former Liverpool star Jan Molby is backing Peter Crouch to start with Dirk Kuyt in attack against AC Milan.



 
AC Milan v Liverpool
Team news ahead of Wednesday's Champions League final between AC Milan and Liverpool in Athens.








GOLF




Rose ready for 'major' challenge
Justin Rose is looking forward to tackling Ernie Els's beefed-up Wentworth at the BMW PGA Championship.



 
Faldo picks Ryder Cup assistants
European Ryder Cup captain Nick Faldo names Jose Maria Olazabal and Paul McGinley as his two assistants for next year's competition in America.



 
Woosnam to miss Wentworth event
Illness forces Ian Woosnam out the PGA Championship at Wentworth.








MOTORSPORT




Lauda 'stunned' by Hamilton start
Triple world champion Niki Lauda says Lewis Hamilton has impressed him more than any other rookie driver he has seen.



 
Raikkonen expects end to problems
Kimi Raikkonen hopes he has made a breakthrough in his struggles to adapt to his new Ferrari.



 
Haydon splits with Virgin Yamaha
James Haydon parts company with British Superbikes team Virgin Yamaha by mutual consent after struggling to adapt to using Pirelli tyres.








FORMULA ONE




Lauda 'stunned' by Hamilton start
Triple world champion Niki Lauda says Lewis Hamilton has impressed him more than any other rookie driver he has seen.



 
Raikkonen expects end to problems
Kimi Raikkonen hopes he has made a breakthrough in his struggles to adapt to his new Ferrari.



 
Hamilton plays down Monaco hopes
Lewis Hamilton says he is "realistic" about winning the Monaco Grand Prix on his Formula One debut in the Principality.








ATHLETICS




Pavey races to Manchester victory
Britain's Jo Pavey produces a world-class performance to win the Great Manchester Run.



 
Sayers sets new UK javelin record
Goldie Sayers breaks the British javelin record with a throw of 65.05m at the Loughborough International meeting.



 
GB trio shine in Great Wall test
Britain has three top-10 finishers in China's Great Wall Marathon as Salvador Calvo smashes the record in one of the world's toughest 26-mile races.








CYCLING




Petacchi wins third Giro sprint
Alessandro Petacchi wins a sprint finish to claim the 11th stage of the Giro d'Italia in Pinerolo.



 
Ace Cavendish continues to dazzle
Britain's Mark Cavendish wins the second stage of the Tour of Catalunya, edging a mass sprint at the finish.



 
Napolitano upsets rival Petacchi
Danilo Napolitano spoils Alessandro Petacchi's hopes of taking a hometown win on stage nine of the Giro d'Italia.








FUN AND GAMES




Champions League Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the competition with our special quiz



 
Quotes of the Week
Lawro says what he thinks about the FA Cup final, plus Mourinho & Warnock



 
Victory is sweet for Pete
Pete Doherty scores the winner as his side win football event
